alert.note: Alert for Hancock; Harrison; Jackson; Pearl River; Pike; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 12:14AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern St. Tammany, northern Tangipahoa and Washington Parishes, southwestern Walthall, southeastern Pike, Harrison, Hancock, southern Jackson and southern Pearl River Counties through 115 AM CDT... At 1211 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Mccomb to near Mcneil to 9 miles west of Saucier to near Escatawpa. Movement was southwest at 25 mph. Gusty winds along an outflow boundary will precede rainfall by 10 or 15 minutes. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Slidell, Ocean Springs, Long Beach, Moss Point, Bogalusa, Picayune, Bay St. Louis, Covington, Waveland, Franklinton, St. Martin, Escatawpa, Diamondhead, Gautier, D`iberville, Pearl River, Abita Springs and Tylertown. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 272 and 273. Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 68. Interstate 55 in Louisiana near mile marker 54. Interstate 59 in Louisiana between mile markers 2 and 11. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 23. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 3 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Hancock; Harrison; Jackson; Pearl River; Pike; Walthall
